intro: Spirabutilon, commonly known as the spiral bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral-shaped inflorescence, which consists of tightly packed, bell-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Spirabutilon is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is found in various regions across Europe and Asia.
